title: Aider Adds DeepSeek R1 Support, Strengthens Position in Local AI Coding
content:
Aider, the terminal-based AI pair programming tool, has announced support for DeepSeek R1 and Chat V3 models, expanding its capabilities for developers who prefer local model deployment. The integration positions Aider as a leading choice for developers seeking full control over their AI coding assistants.

DeepSeek R1, a distilled model based on Qwen-14B tailored specifically for code, delivers impressive performance on coding tasks while being efficient enough to run on modest hardware. This aligns with Aider's philosophy of giving developers complete control over their development environment and AI model choices.

Aider now supports Claude 3.7 Sonnet, DeepSeek models, OpenAI o1/o3-mini, and GPT-4o, while maintaining compatibility with virtually any LLM including local models. The tool's ability to directly edit multiple files across a codebase and automatic git integration continues to set it apart from closed-source alternatives.

As noted by Thoughtworks in their Technology Radar, Aider's approach of running locally with developers' own API keys means they pay only for actual AI model usage without markup. This cost-effectiveness, combined with full control over context and data privacy, makes it particularly attractive for security-conscious organizations.

The update reinforces a growing trend toward smaller, specialized models that organizations can run independently, reducing dependence on cloud-based AI services while maintaining high performance for specific tasks like code generation and refactoring.
summary: Aider adds support for DeepSeek R1 and Chat V3 models, strengthening its position as the terminal-based AI coding tool of choice for developers seeking local model control.
author: Aider Team
